newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Avantel signs up Grupo Sidek.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Avantel signs up Grupo Sidek.

text.p: Mexican telecommunications company Avantel SA signed a contract on Tuesday to provide long distance service to conglomerate Grupo Sidek SA.
The Guadalajara-based Sidek has interests in steel and tourism and generates about one million minutes in telephone traffic a month, said Avantel's director general Manuel Sanchez Lugo.
Avantel is a joint venture between MCI Communications Corp and Grupo Financiero Banamex-Accival, Mexico's largest banking group.
Avantel marketing director Jorge Rodriguez said the company has signed between 20 and 30 large corporate clients in the past few weeks and is negotiating with others.
Avantel has lagged in pre-subscription balloting in the northern city of Monterrey compared to its rivals, the AT&T Corp -backed Alestra and ex-monopoly Telefonos de Mexico.
But Sanchez Lugo said the company was focused on high volume clients and was encouraged by improvements in the balloting process with each successive city that opens to competition.
